thread.title: Phillies remove Domonic Brown from 40-man roster
thread.title_full: Phillies remove Domonic Brown from 40-man roster

title: Phillies remove Domonic Brown from 40-man roster
text:
Phillies remove Domonic Brown from 40-man roster Meghan Montemurro , The News Journal 7:56 p.m. EDT October 19, 2015 Phillies right fielder Domonic Brown strikes out to end the fourth inning Aug. 26 against the New York Mets at Citizens Bank Park. (Photo: Eric Hartline-USA TODAY Sports) 1 CONNECT 6 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Outfielder Domonic Brown's career with the Phillies appears to be over. 
Brown was outrighted off the Phillies' 40-man roster on Monday along with fellow outfielders Brian Bogusevic and Kelly Dugan and catcher Tommy Joseph. Brown can elect free agency. 
Brown was an All-Star in 2013 but struggled since. He even had an inglorious finish to his 2015 season. It ended prematurely when he suffered a concussion Sept. 2 at Citi Field when he flipped over the low wall down the right field line after he failed to make a catch. 
The 28-year-old Brown, a 20th-round pick of the organization in 2006, hit .228 with a .634 OPS, five home runs and 25 RBIs in 63 games this season. After hitting 27 home runs and recording 83 RBIs in 540 plate appearances during his All-Star season in 2013, Brown combined for only 15 homers and 88 RBIs in 716 total plate appearances since. 
Concussion issues have plagued Joseph's career since he joined the organization. Joseph, 24, was the Phillies' primary acquisition in the trade that sent Hunter Pence to the San Francisco Giants at the deadline in 2012. Joseph has played in only 149 minor league games over his 3.5 seasons in the Phillies' organization. Read or Share this story: http://delonline.us/1LGHKV8 TOP VIDEOS
